panels.description: This panel displays the rate of requests grouped by latency buckets (e.g., <50ms, <100ms, etc.) for each route in APISIX over the last 30 minutes. It helps in monitoring and identifying the latency performance across different routes
panels.title: Request Latency Distribution by Route

panels.description: This query will return the total number of responses grouped by routes
panels.title: Count of HTTP responses grouped by route

panels.description: This gives the latency grouped by route.
panels.title: Latency for Specific Route

panels.description: This gives you average latency per request grouped by route.
panels.title: Average Latency per request by Route

panels.description: This gives the total request count based on each route
panels.title: Total Request Count per Route

panels.description: This panel shows the 95th percentile of request latency per route over a rolling 10-minute window. High values may indicate performance degradation or bottlenecks in specific API routes.
panels.title: 95th Percentile Latency per Route (10m Window)

panels.description: his query will return the total number of responses grouped by HTTP status codes
panels.title: HTTP responses by status code
Accepted or Handled requests

panels.description: To visualize the latency sum over time
panels.title: Latency Trend (Time Series)

panels.description: apisix_http_requests_total This is a counter metric that typically increases over time, representing the total number of HTTP requests processed by APISIX. The rate() function calculates the per-second average increase of the counter over the specified time range. This panel shows us the average number of HTTP requests that have been processed per second over the last 5 minutes.
panels.title: Apisix HTTP QPS

panels.description: A modify index is a versioning mechanism that tracks changes made to a particular key. This will return the highest modify index for each key.
panels.title: Highest Modify Index for each Key

panels.description:
apisix_shared_dict_capacity_bytes is Total allocated memory size.

apisix_shared_dict_free_space_bytes is Free (unused) memory in that dictionary.
1 - (free / capacity) gives the fraction used.
This gives you the percentage of used memory in APISIX's shared memory dictionary to monitor memory usage in shared dicts.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description:
This query will return the total number of active HTTP connections grouped by their state
active: Connections that are currently active.

reading: Connections where the server is reading the request header.

writing: Connections where the server is writing the response back to the client.

waiting: Idle connections waiting for a reque
panels.title: Current HTTP connections grouped by their state

panels.description: apisix_nginx_http_current_connections indicates the number of current HTTP connections managed by APISIX's Nginx component. The label selector {state="active"} filters the metric to only include data points that have the label state with the value "active". The result of this query shows you the current number of active HTTP connections managed by the APISIX instance's Nginx. This is useful for monitoring the load on your system.
panels.title: Active HTTP Connections

panels.description: Shows Requests per Second
panels.title: Request Throughput (RPS)

panels.description: This query gives you the total egress bandwidth over a 5-minute window.
panels.title: Egress Bandwidth (Outflow)

panels.description:
apisix_etcd_reachable indicates whether APISIX is successfully able to reach its etcd backend. Likely returns 1 when etcd is reachable.

Returns 0 (or otherwise signals failure) when etcd is unreachable.
panels.title: Etcd Reachability

panels.description: This query gives you the total ingress bandwidth over a 5-minute window.

panels.title: Ingress Bandwidth

panels.description: apisix_nginx_metric_errors_total counts the total number of errors encountered while collecting or processing Nginx metrics in APISIX.
panels.title: Error

panels.description:
(rate(apisix_nginx_metric_errors_total[5m]) / rate(apisix_http_requests_total[5m]))

It calculates the fraction of HTTP requests that resulted in errors, by dividing the error rate by the request rate over a 5-minute interval.
panels.title: Error Rate

panels.description: This panel is used to display which nodes are running APISIX, what version theyre using, and other identifying metadata.
panels.title: Apisix Node Info
